Attention African American community! If you financed a vehicle at McNeill Chevrolet Swanton, OH (20112018), this affects YOU! 1/ I was their Finance Manager & endured racist slurs like Harambe, Token Black Guy, & pay cuts to $150/week without notice. I resigned in 2018 due to discrimination. 2/ After resigning, my minority-owned business was vandalized & ignored by Swanton PD. McNeill reps even impersonated police to harass me during a false investigation. 3/ The Ohio Civil Rights Commission found probable cause of racial discrimination at McNeill Chevrolet against African Americans. This is serious. 4/ If you financed there, join the boycott & send your loan/warranty docs to the Ohio Civil Rights Commission. A class action lawsuit is coming & you could be owed thousands! 5/ Follow & support & Minister Marquis L. Kimble Sr. for updates. Share this thread & spread the word! More info:

NEW: I'm glad , , and have re-ignited a conversation about the movement. This all started five years ago after viral videos showed Asian Americans getting beat, harassed, and unfairly blamed for causing the Covid-19 outbreak. The perpetrators were primarily Black and Brown folks in cities with huge Asian communities like San Francisco, Philadelphia, and New York. Mainstream media initially covered most of the incidents, but then it suddenly died down. However, the attacks continued. Out of this chaos emerged an advocacy group called . The non-profit helped mobilize rallies and collected data on all the incidents. But for some reason, this left-leaning organization never included the race or ethnicities of the suspects. During an interview a couple years ago, I pressed Stop AAPI Hate Co-Founder Manjusha Kulkarni about this discrepancy. Kulkarni would not give me a straight answer and claimed most of the attackers were not African American. It's unclear if we will ever get the actual data on these perps. Instead, she implied these incidents were being unfairly covered by mainstream and social media and called this an example of "white supremacy." She goes on to say situations involving white attackers were far more egregious. Kulkarni concluded by saying race doesn't matter and policy solutions should be the focus of preventing these crimes. The hashtag gained significant attention in 2020 as anti-Asian violence surged during the COVID-19 pandemic. This movement has played a vital role in raising awareness about the challenges faced by Asian communities, fostering a deeper understanding and empathy among the public. Furthermore, what makes particularly impactful is how it encourages individuals to share their personal experiences, creating a sense of unity among Asian Americans and their allies. This collective sharing has sparked important conversations about racism and the need for solidarity. As more people engaged with the movement, it also caught the attention of lawmakers, leading to discussions about stronger protections against hate crimes. In short, highlights how social media can amplify marginalized voices and strengthen community ties in the fight against discrimination. It serves as a reminder that we can work toward a more just and compassionate society if we unite to speak up for our voice

WHY I FIGHT RACISM: A LIFETIME OF WITNESS AND RESISTANCE My friends often ask why I keep writing about racism in the U.S., the U.K., and beyond. The answer is simple: Ive seen too much to ever stay silent. As a child in New York, I watched the assassination of President Kennedy live a shattering moment. My father, the most senior African diplomat in the U.S. at the time, was the first African Under-Secretary of the United Nations. Through him, I met Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., Bobby and Edward Kennedy, and many civil rights heroes. My father also served as senior Crown Counsel to the late Queen Elizabeth, a Queens Counsel, and my own elite education at Eton College gave me a rare vantage point. I have seen, firsthand, both the power of progress and the forces determined to tear it down. Thats why watching Trump and Musk two racist, slimy grifters systematically attack the very civil rights people died for fills me with disgust and fury. Musk, a white South African, grew up under apartheid and has never shed its poison. His racism is not just casual its calculated. And Trump? Mark my words: he will fall on his own sword this August, brought down by the very system he thought he could break. As for the U.K., I know England too well to buy the lies of Kemi Badenoch, the Conservative leader. She, a daughter of Nigerian immigrants, betrays the immigrant struggle with her Uncle Tom posturing. But racists always prefer white faces to front their hate and theyve failed with both Rishi Sunak and Badenoch. I fought racism in 1960s and 70s England not yesterday and I will never stop because Im comfortable today. I never met anyone as low as Elon Musk or Donald Trump in my time at the University of Pennsylvania, even though they graduated from the same institution. Watching them now, especially Musk, sickens me to my core. Until Trumps executive orders are wiped away and his racist legacy trashed, the fight continues and this man, Kio Amachree, will not be silent.

THERE IS NO "systemic racism" IN THIS COUNTRY! Turn on your t.v. Watch a game show. Minorities everywhere. Commercials ditto. Sports ditto. Game show and talk show hosts of a minority persuasion are some of the most loved and best paid people in our country. Ditto movie stars. Watch the news. Almost every big city mayor, and police or fire chief is from the ranks of "the minority". State and federal governments are filled with representatives of minority communities. In what area of our society is systemic racism manifested? We elected a Black president--twice--for goodness sake! If there is some sort of "systemic racism", i think it must be invisible. (And, if it is, then you can hardly call it "systemic", can you?) No! Wait! I just figured it out! Since you can now say a woman is a man, and a man is a woman, you can also say that omnipresent minority representation is actually its opposite! Hence, "systemic racism", no matter what the objectively quantifiable reality is! Q.E.D. (However, it appears that, recently, our non-existent systemic racism has morphed into non-existent homophobia.) BUT... I wrote all that some time ago. A similar "invisible"/evidence-absent quality may be found in Liberal assertions of the threat of avertable climate change, a secure southern border, an unobjectionable federal election in 2020, a bat-generated Corona virus, the threat posed by white supremacists and militias, the benefits of gun control, a democracy threatening insurrection on Jan. 6, 2021, the "mostly peaceful" riots of 2020, the effectiveness of masks and vaccines in preventing transmission of Covid-19, the necessity and propriety of providing what is referred to as "gender affirming care" including homosexual pornography in elementary school libraries, Hunter Biden's laptop being "Russian disinformation", the epidemic of police murdering unarmed Blacks, Russian collusion in the 2016 federal election, the dangers of fracking, and the viability of electric vehicles.
